issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description: I believe that the apt package is built without S3 support. But s3fs.h is exported in filesystem/api.h anyway. This creates undefined reference errors when trying to link to the package.
fields.summary: [C++] apt package includes headers for S3 interface, but no support

comments.body: Could you show full error log?

We install all public API headers unconditional on whether all the APIs in them are supported by the shared library or not. To do otherwise consistently would be a significant amount of work, so I'm not sure this is worth fixing

Full error log when compiling [^test.cpp]:

{noformat}
Scanning dependencies of target test.o
[ 50%] Building CXX object CMakeFiles/test.o.dir/test.cpp.o
[100%] Linking CXX executable test.o
CMakeFiles/test.o.dir/test.cpp.o: In function `main':
test.cpp:(.text+0x26): undefined reference to `arrow::fs::S3Options::Defaults()'
test.cpp:(.text+0x3f): undefined reference to `arrow::fs::S3FileSystem::Make(arrow::fs::S3Options const&)'
collect2: error: ld returned 1 exit status
CMakeFiles/test.o.dir/build.make:104: recipe for target 'test.o' failed
make[2]: *** [test.o] Error 1
CMakeFiles/Makefile2:95: recipe for target 'CMakeFiles/test.o.dir/all' failed
make[1]: *** [CMakeFiles/test.o.dir/all] Error 2
Makefile:103: recipe for target 'all' failed
make: *** [all] Error 2
{noformat}

Thanks.

I confirmed that we don't get any build errors by removing {{arrow::fs::S3FileSytem::Make(...)}}.

You say that it should be a compile error such as no {{arrow::fs::S3FileSystem::Make}} definition not a link error, right?
I think that it is a linker error. The program compiles, it just can't link to those libarrow symbols.

Yes, the current behavior is a link error.
I wanted to confirm that the expected behavior.
Oh! Sorry, I misunderstood. Yes, I think a compiler error would be more clear.
This could be possible using defines in the generated config header {{arrow/util/config.h}}.

Yes.
Adding {{#cmakedefine ARROW_S3}} into {{cpp/src/arrow/util/config.h.cmake}} and using {{ARROW_S3}} to add {{#ifdef}} in {{cpp/src/arrow/filesystem/api.h}} is an easy fix for this.
[~kou] are you planning on doing anything with this for 2.0?

Yes.
I'll do this today or tomorrow.
